title: Accessing Top
text: TOP (Table Ordering Platform) is specifically designed for consumer self-service, allowing customers to access it by scanning a unique QR code or tapping an NFC tag. The QR code or NFC tag contains a URL that redirects them to the TOP application, carrying all the necessary identifiable information, such as the tenant, location, and table number. For detailed information on URL and QR code generation, please refer to the "Self-Serve Admin Shops" section, which provides comprehensive instructions on how to generate these unique codes. It's important to note that without setting up a supported Payment Provider, TOP functionality will be unavailable. To enable TOP and configure the appropriate Payment Provider, please consult the "Payment Providers" section for step-by-step instructions and further details.
description:
TOP (Table Ordering Platform) is specifically designed for consumer self-service, allowing customers to access it by scanning a unique QR code or tapping an NFC tag. The QR code or NFC tag contains a URL that redirects them to the TOP application, carrying all the necessary identifiable information, such as the tenant, location, and table number.


For detailed information on URL and QR code generation, please refer to the "Self-Serve Admin Shops" section, which provides comprehensive instructions on how to generate these unique codes.


It's important to note that without setting up a supported Payment Provider, TOP functionality will be unavailable. To enable TOP and configure the appropriate Payment Provider, please consult the "Payment Providers" section for step-by-step instructions and further details.

title: Home View
text: Upon scanning a QR code or visiting the URL, users will be directed to the Home View within the TOP application. The Home View serves as the central hub for customers to browse and select the items they wish to order through TOP. To streamline the ordering process, the TOP application always presents the Landing Group of the selected store as the starting point for navigation. This hierarchical structure and navigation can be expanded and customized according to specific requirements using the Composer Groups functionality within Visual Composer. This allows for a tailored and personalized user experience, enhancing the efficiency and flexibility of the ordering process. You can choose to drill into the subgroups (black tiles) to see another layer of the hierarchy, or you can use the +/- buttons to add your items to the basket. If you press the + on an item which is a Bundle or has Modifiers, you will be asked to make your selections before adding to the basket. TOP is aware of your current stock levels. So if you run out of stock it will display Sold Out on the Tile and will be unavailable for selection by a customer. There are various ways a customer can navigate the page. Icon Name Function Search Bar Users can utilize the Search bar to quickly find specific items they wish to add to their basket. By entering relevant keywords or item names, users can easily locate and select desired items, enhancing the efficiency of the ordering process. On Screen Navigation If you have Bundle Groups set up, you will see navigation buttons appear when in those groups. For example Home > Drinks > Pepsi / Sprite / Coke. you can use this to return to the Home Screen or a section by selecting the POS. Information Button This button will show the user your Terms and Conditions, FAQ, Delivery Information and Privacy Policy if you have them configured. Table Number It also displays the Table number which it extracts from the scanned URL. Product Information By tapping on the tile with the "i" symbol, users can access the supplementary information and explore any available Bundle Groups or Modifiers associated with the selected item, enhancing their overall ordering experience and allowing for further customization. Basket Button Tapping the basket button allows you to review and verify the items in your basket, ensuring accuracy and making any necessary adjustments if needed. Once you have confirmed the contents of your basket, you can proceed to the payment stage, where you will be prompted to complete the transaction.
description:
Upon scanning a QR code or visiting the URL, users will be directed to the Home View within the TOP application.


The Home View serves as the central hub for customers to browse and select the items they wish to order through TOP.


To streamline the ordering process, the TOP application always presents the Landing Group of the selected store as the starting point for navigation. This hierarchical structure and navigation can be expanded and customized according to specific requirements using the Composer Groups functionality within Visual Composer. This allows for a tailored and personalized user experience, enhancing the efficiency and flexibility of the ordering process.



You can choose to drill into the subgroups (black tiles) to see another layer of the hierarchy, or you can use the +/- buttons to add your items to the basket. If you press the + on an item which is a Bundle or has Modifiers, you will be asked to make your selections before adding to the basket.


TOP is aware of your current stock levels. So if you run out of stock it will display Sold Out on the Tile and will be unavailable for selection by a customer.



There are various ways a customer can navigate the page. 


Icon

On Screen NavigationIf you have Bundle Groups set up, you will see navigation buttons appear when in those groups. For example Home > Drinks > Pepsi / Sprite / Coke. you can use this to return to the Home Screen or a section by selecting the POS.
Information ButtonThis button will show the user your Terms and Conditions, FAQ, Delivery Information and Privacy Policy if you have them configured.
Table NumberIt also displays the Table number which it extracts from the scanned URL.
Product InformationBy tapping on the tile with the "i" symbol, users can access the supplementary information and explore any available Bundle Groups or Modifiers associated with the selected item, enhancing their overall ordering experience and allowing for further customization.
Basket ButtonTapping the basket button allows you to review and verify the items in your basket, ensuring accuracy and making any necessary adjustments if needed. Once you have confirmed the contents of your basket, you can proceed to the payment stage, where you will be prompted to complete the transaction.

title: Items / Bundles / Modifiers
text: When you add a Bundle or Modifiable item to your basket, you will be prompted to make the relevant selections before adding them to the basket. If your Bundle main item has Modifiers linked to it, it will automatically take you to the Modifiers tab if you wish to make any alterations. Non-bundled items with Modifiers will only show you the Modifiers. The min max rule for selections is displayed next to the Modifier title, You will also see any additional prices for the modifiers. Modifications that you make get printed on the order confirmation slip and also make their way through to the Order Status Display to be used in the order preparation area. NOTE: You can also add manually entered comments against the line too. Modifications and Comments that you apply make their way through to the Order Status Display to be used in the order preparation area.
description:
When you add a Bundle or Modifiable item to your basket, you will be prompted to make the relevant selections before adding them to the basket.


If your Bundle main item has Modifiers linked to it, it will automatically take you to the Modifiers tab if you wish to make any alterations.



Non-bundled items with Modifiers will only show you the Modifiers. 


The min max rule for selections is displayed next to the Modifier title, You will also see any additional prices for the modifiers. 


Modifications that you make get printed on the order confirmation slip and also make their way through to the Order Status Display to be used in the order preparation area.


NOTE: You can also add manually entered comments against the line too.



Modifications and Comments that you apply make their way through to the Order Status Display to be used in the order preparation area.

title: Basket / Payment
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Basket Payment Basket The Basket screen is a listing of all of your items, along with any bundle selections and modifiers you have made. They are grouped, so if you have made more than one item with the same selections and modifiers they will be on the same basket line. It denotes the extended price of the basket line and also displays the quantity multiplied by the single item price. Icon Name Function Edit Line You can use the pencil icon for the basket line to make alterations to that line (change modifiers or bundle selections) Delete Line Use the trash can icon to remove the line from the basket Delete Basket Use the black trash can next to the Pay button to clear the basket and return to the start screen Continue Button Use the Continue button to proceed to the payment phase. Payment Pressing the Continue button will then ask you for your email address and optionally some other parameters which vary between payment providers and partner extensions. If the payment is successful, then it means that the payment has been made and the transaction has been submitted to Imagine's backend for onward processing. After confirming the order, TOP will initiate the following actions: Submit the order to the Order Status Display (OSD): The order details will be sent to the OSD, enabling staff to process and prepare the order efficiently. Display the order number: A unique order number will be generated and displayed on the screen. This order number serves as a reference for tracking and can be used in both the OSD and ORB. Email order confirmation and receipt: TOP will automatically send an email to the customer, containing an order confirmation and receipt. The email will include the order number, and selected bundle choices, and applied modifiers, ensuring transparency and providing a record of the transaction. Provide estimated waiting time: The application calculates an estimated waiting time based on the order throughput over the last 15 minutes. This feature helps manage customer expectations by providing an approximate timeframe for order preparation. These functionalities aim to streamline the ordering process, enhance communication between staff and customers, and provide a smooth and satisfying user experience.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Basket
  • Payment

Basket

The Basket screen is a listing of all of your items, along with any bundle selections and modifiers you have made. They are grouped, so if you have made more than one item with the same selections and modifiers they will be on the same basket line. It denotes the extended price of the basket line and also displays the quantity multiplied by the single item price.



IconNameFunction
Edit LineYou can use the pencil icon for the basket line to make alterations to that line (change modifiers or bundle selections)
Delete LineUse the trash can icon to remove the line from the basket
Delete BasketUse the black trash can next to the Pay button to clear the basket and return to the start screen
Continue ButtonUse the Continue button to proceed to the payment phase.

Payment

Pressing the Continue button will then ask you for your email address and optionally some other parameters which vary between payment providers and partner extensions.

 


If the payment is successful, then it means that the payment has been made and the transaction has been submitted to Imagine's backend for onward processing. 

   


After confirming the order, TOP will initiate the following actions:


Submit the order to the Order Status Display (OSD): The order details will be sent to the OSD, enabling staff to process and prepare the order efficiently.


Display the order number: A unique order number will be generated and displayed on the screen. This order number serves as a reference for tracking and can be used in both the OSD and ORB.


Email order confirmation and receipt: TOP will automatically send an email to the customer, containing an order confirmation and receipt. The email will include the order number, and selected bundle choices, and applied modifiers, ensuring transparency and providing a record of the transaction.


Provide estimated waiting time: The application calculates an estimated waiting time based on the order throughput over the last 15 minutes. This feature helps manage customer expectations by providing an approximate timeframe for order preparation.


These functionalities aim to streamline the ordering process, enhance communication between staff and customers, and provide a smooth and satisfying user experience.

title: Customer documentation for K3 MStore TOP
text: Imagine and MStore K3Topsync Customer guide TABLE OF CONTENTS 1.Description 2.Imagine TOP (Table Order and Pay functions) 3.MStore side setup 4. K3TopSynch 5. Operation 6. Advice on functionality 1.Description The TOP (Table Order and Pay) Imagine application has been integrated to MStore so that it can be used as a cloud based Portal point of sale for Café/Resturant situations. This will allow customers to scan a QR code using a mobile device or smart phone which then opens a Shop related to the MStore site. Orders can be paid for online, this then creates orders in MStore specifically assigned to a Till MStore side which are then visualised on both Food prep/Kitchen and Customer facing order boards. The desired MStore items which need to exisit in Imagine TOP are marked in MStore and synchronised to Imagine via the K3TopSynch application which synchronises both Items and Transactions from TOP. There is also Membership integration where Members can validate their number to receive a membership discount on the order based on an overall percentage that is assigned in MStore Membership privileges Imagine discount percentage. 2.Imagine TOP (Table Order and Pay functions) Imagine is accessed through the customer Portal where the SelfServe Modules will have been configured and customised for the application. Imagine Portal Https://Portal.K3Imagine.com Within the Backoffice the Modules associated with TOP will be visible as below. Shop A shop can now be setup in the Backoffice/Shops Module as below example. An Email address should be included in the shop setup above as this will provide a forwarding address from which the TOP emailed receipts can be sent from Imagine. Ideally a noreply for customer purposes. Payment Provider (Self Serve Admin) A complete help link below to customer knowledge base is below. https://support.k3btg.com/en/support/solutions/articles/103000262086-stripe-setup-for-top The Stripe Payment provider will be registered by the customer The Webhook and Secret keys are provided by the registration process. https://dashboard.stripe.com/register Visual Composer A complete guide to setting up the Tiles for the online shop can accessed using the link below. https://support.k3btg.com/en/support/solutions/folders/103000304183 Accessed from SelfServe Admin Module this is where we setup the visual tiles that build the shop which is what the customer sees as a point of purchase. Example Here is what can be composed as a customer facing shop Product Configurator This is where the Items within Imagine Self Serve can be priced for promotion. This is also where the Modifier Groups are setup for the shop basket and checkout page. Here is the link to Imagine online help for detailed functionality. Example of where modifiers are shown in image below. https://support.k3btg.com/en/support/solutions/folders/103000304181 TOP (Table order and pay) Shop A QR code can now be generated which will create a url that loads the TOP shop visual pages. This can be accessed from Self Serve Admin/Shops as below. Functionality on Self Serve Admin can be found here in the Imagine online help. This is also where the Visual profiles to each of the shops can be assigned as well as Timeslots. These are explained in the online help link below. https://support.k3btg.com/en/support/solutions/articles/103000050221-top-tables 3.MStore side setup MStore Backoffice settings A Till will be setup in MStore backoffice Tills configuration an example as below. Bearing in mind printers/Depts may differ for specific customers. The Till type has to be set as “Handheld Table Ordering” Items which are required to be synched to Imagine TOP will need to be marked in MStore as example below. There is Membership Discount feature in the integration which allows members to have a set discount percentage applied to a TOP transaction. This discount is applied specifically to the member and does not allow varying discount percentages to be Item or Analysis code specific. Example setting as below in MStore backoffice membership types The membership discount/validation feature is displayed in the Basket section of the Imagine TOP as below and can be skipped if not required. MStore Order boards and customer Order Ready Boards. Although Imagine does have it’s own set of Order boards for both prep and customer these are not used for the MStore setup. MStore has it’s own applications for this purpose and since the MStore customer may also have Orders created in house on the MStore system outside of the Imagine TOP it makes sense that both in house MStore and Imagine TOP are displayed together rather than on separate boards, therefore we use the MStore applications for this purpose. PkitchenDisplay This is the board that displays the prep/Kitchen orders that are generated from both MStore (in house) and TOP. It’s configuration is set in the MStore.ini file located in C:\programdata\merac and as can be seen below defines rows, column sizes,Dept, Prep area and font size. The Dept for each customer will be the related dept set in MStore Backoffice for this example we can see that the Till 7000 is set to Sootys Diner Dept which is 47. The KitchenOrderPrep value 1 is set as the initial prep area defined in the K3Topsync settings. Example of PKitchenDisplay, clicking into the order let’s you progress the order and also print if required to kitchen printer or quit. FoodOrderDisplay This is the customer facing board which takes it’s settings from C:\Program Files\Merac\FoodOrderDisplay.exe.config This is an xml file which will be setup as part of the implementation. This will display as below 4. K3TopSynch K3TopSync v1.01 is an application which integrates MStore with the K3|TOP online selling portal. Using the K3TOPSYNC application When launching the program normally, you get the option to sync products or transactions. For a transaction sync, you must choose a date range. The program defaults to yesterday. You should not download “today’s” transactions unless you are sure there will be no more transactions, otherwise a duplicate cashdrawer would be created. You can choose a date span if you like. Any transactions already downloaded will be ignored. Once all transactions are downloaded, the program runs a database procedure which created cashdrawers for each new day with transactions. When syncing products, any PLU which has been ticked to go to K3|TOP will be uploaded. If the product already exists in K3|TOP, its record will be updated. Configuration changes to K3TopSynch can be made from Tools/Configuration These settings will have been set during implementation but it is possible that Polling times may want to be modified to optomise orders. E.g. 5. Operation a: Create all Items in MStore including complete meals and modifiers. b: For purposes of membership check Imagine discount settings in membership priviledge schemes in MStore. c: Run the K3 K3Topsync app and it will create the Items in Imagine that have been marked as Imagine in MStore. d: Load the TOP store in either a browser or a mobile using the shop QR code or url generated in SelfServe Admin/Shops e: Make a purchase using the TOP app and wait for the K3TopSync polling to finish synching transactions. f: Run the PKitchen.exe and check the order has appeared also check the Foodorderdisplay.exe board to show “preparing” now complete the order in the PKitchen.exe display, Foodorderdisplay changes to “Please Collect” g: The assigned TOP Till in MStore can be finalized as normal MStore operations. 6. Advice on functionality Not all of the Imagine Self Serve functionality applies to this implementation. TOP is purely meant to be used as a selling portal to MStore items. Bundles and Bundle Groups functionality will not be synched back to MStore and is therefore redundant. Any bundled items or meals need to be created in MStore. Imagine order boards could be used but crucially will only show Imagine orders and not orders created in MStore. TOP Timeslot functionality does work and affects the MStore order boards. Item descriptions in MStore are taken from the extended description and synched to the description in Imagine TOP to allow greater flexibility. Membership discounting is on a transaction level and so applies a fixed percentage to the transaction and doesn’t work in the same way that MStore discounts do where they can be applied at a Item and Analysis code level.
description:
Imagine and MStore K3Topsync Customer guide


  

TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • 1.Description
  • 2.Imagine TOP (Table Order and Pay functions)
  • 3.MStore side setup
  • 4. K3TopSynch
  • 5. Operation
  • 6. Advice on functionality



1.Description

The TOP (Table Order and Pay) Imagine application has been integrated to MStore so that it can be used as a cloud based Portal point of sale for Café/Resturant situations.

This will allow customers to scan a QR code using a mobile device or smart phone which then opens a Shop related to the MStore site. Orders can be paid for online, this then creates orders in MStore specifically assigned to a Till MStore side which are then visualised on both Food prep/Kitchen and Customer facing order boards.

The desired MStore items which need to exisit in Imagine TOP are marked in MStore and synchronised to Imagine via the K3TopSynch application which synchronises both Items and Transactions from TOP.

There is also Membership integration where Members can validate their number to receive a membership discount on the order based on an overall percentage that is assigned in MStore Membership privileges Imagine discount percentage.
 

2.Imagine TOP (Table Order and Pay functions)

Imagine is accessed through the customer Portal where the SelfServe Modules will have been configured and customised for the application.

Imagine Portal

Https://Portal.K3Imagine.com

 

Within the Backoffice the Modules associated with TOP will be visible as below.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Shop

A shop can now be setup in the Backoffice/Shops Module as below example.

 

 

 

 

An Email address should be included in the shop setup above as this will provide a forwarding address from which the TOP emailed receipts can be sent from Imagine.

Ideally a noreply for customer purposes.

 

 

 

 

Payment Provider (Self Serve Admin) 

A complete help link below to customer knowledge base is below.

https://support.k3btg.com/en/support/solutions/articles/103000262086-stripe-setup-for-top

 

The Stripe Payment provider will be registered by the customer 

 

The Webhook and Secret keys are provided by the registration process.

https://dashboard.stripe.com/register

 

 

 

 

Visual Composer

A complete guide to setting up the Tiles for the online shop can accessed using the link below.

https://support.k3btg.com/en/support/solutions/folders/103000304183

Accessed from SelfServe Admin Module this is where we setup the visual tiles that build the shop which is what the customer sees as a point of purchase.

Example

Here is what can be composed as a customer facing shop

 

 

 

 

 

 

Product Configurator

This is where the Items within Imagine Self Serve can be priced for promotion. This is also where the Modifier Groups are setup for the shop basket and checkout page. Here is the link to Imagine online help for detailed functionality. Example of where modifiers are shown in image below.

https://support.k3btg.com/en/support/solutions/folders/103000304181

 

 

 

 

 

 

TOP (Table order and pay) Shop 

A QR code can now be generated which will create a url that loads the TOP shop visual pages. This can be accessed from Self Serve Admin/Shops as below. Functionality on Self Serve Admin can be found here in the Imagine online help.

This is also where the Visual profiles to each of the shops can be assigned as well as Timeslots. These are explained in the online help link below.

https://support.k3btg.com/en/support/solutions/articles/103000050221-top-tables

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

3.MStore side setup

 

MStore Backoffice settings

A Till will be setup in MStore backoffice Tills configuration an example as below. Bearing in mind printers/Depts may differ for specific customers. 

The Till type has to be set as “Handheld Table Ordering”

 

 

Items which are required to be synched to Imagine TOP will need to be marked in MStore as example below.

 

 

There is Membership Discount feature in the integration which allows members to have a set discount percentage applied to a TOP transaction. This discount is applied specifically to the member and does not allow varying discount percentages to be Item or Analysis code specific. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Example setting as below in MStore backoffice membership types

 

 

The membership discount/validation feature is displayed in the Basket section of the Imagine TOP as below and can be skipped if not required.

 

 

 

MStore Order boards and customer Order Ready Boards.

Although Imagine does have it’s own set of Order boards for both prep and customer these are not used for the MStore setup. MStore has it’s own applications for this purpose and since the MStore customer may also have Orders created in house on the MStore system outside of the Imagine TOP it makes sense that both in house MStore and Imagine TOP are displayed together rather than on separate boards, therefore we use the MStore applications for this purpose.

 

 

 

PkitchenDisplay

This is the board that displays the prep/Kitchen orders that are generated from both MStore (in house) and TOP. It’s configuration is set in the MStore.ini file located in C:\programdata\merac and as can be seen below defines rows, column sizes,Dept, Prep area and font size.

 

The Dept for each customer will be the related dept set in MStore Backoffice for this example we can see that the Till 7000 is set to Sootys Diner Dept which is 47. 

 

 

The KitchenOrderPrep value 1 is set as the initial prep area defined in the K3Topsync settings.

Example of PKitchenDisplay, clicking into the order let’s you progress the order and also print if required to kitchen printer or quit.

 

 

 

 

 

 

FoodOrderDisplay

This is the customer facing board which takes it’s settings from 

C:\Program Files\Merac\FoodOrderDisplay.exe.config

This is an xml file which will be setup as part of the implementation.

 

This will display as below

 

 

4. K3TopSynch

K3TopSync v1.01 is an application which integrates MStore with the K3|TOP online selling portal.

 

Using the K3TOPSYNC application

  • When launching the program normally, you get the option to sync products or transactions.  For a transaction sync, you must choose a date range.   The program defaults to yesterday.

     
  • You should not download “today’s” transactions unless you are sure there will be no more transactions, otherwise a duplicate cashdrawer would be created.

     
  • You can choose a date span if you like.   Any transactions already downloaded will be ignored.

     
  • Once all transactions are downloaded, the program runs a database procedure which created cashdrawers for each new day with transactions.

 

When syncing products, any PLU which has been ticked to go to K3|TOP will be uploaded.  If the product already exists in K3|TOP, its record will be updated.
 

 



 

 

 

 

Configuration changes to K3TopSynch can be made from Tools/Configuration

 

These settings will have been set during implementation but it is possible that Polling times may want to be modified to optomise orders.

E.g.

 

5. Operation

a: Create all Items in MStore including complete meals and modifiers.

b: For purposes of membership check Imagine discount settings in membership priviledge schemes in MStore.

c: Run the K3 K3Topsync app and it will create the Items in Imagine that have been marked as Imagine in MStore.

d: Load the TOP store in either a browser or a mobile using the shop QR code or url generated in SelfServe Admin/Shops

e: Make a purchase using the TOP app and wait for the K3TopSync polling to finish synching transactions.

f: Run the PKitchen.exe and check the order has appeared also check the Foodorderdisplay.exe board to show “preparing” now complete the order in the PKitchen.exe display, Foodorderdisplay changes to “Please Collect”

g: The assigned TOP Till in MStore can be finalized as normal MStore operations.

6. Advice on functionality

Not all of the Imagine Self Serve functionality applies to this implementation. TOP is purely meant to be used as a selling portal to MStore items. 

Bundles and Bundle Groups functionality will not be synched back to MStore and is therefore redundant. Any bundled items or meals need to be created in MStore.

Imagine order boards could be used but crucially will only show Imagine orders and not orders created in MStore.

TOP Timeslot functionality does work and affects the MStore order boards.

Item descriptions in MStore are taken from the extended description and synched to the description in Imagine TOP to allow greater flexibility.

Membership discounting is on a transaction level and so applies a fixed percentage to the transaction and doesn’t work in the same way that MStore discounts do where they can be applied at a Item and Analysis code level.
